verbs.label: Altar: Ascite
verbs.Desc: The Horned-Axe, who opens the way and keeps the threshold, is accounted the last of the Gods-from-Stone.

verbs.label: Shrine: St Januarius
verbs.Desc: St Januarius is the Name which was wounded; the Name of exceptions; the little god at the door.

verbs.label: Calicite Altar
verbs.Desc: The Red Grail, birth and appetite, denied and condemned by the clergy of the Sun for her temptress-role in the Sun's division. Those of us who oppose Eternity might instead give her thanks and praise. But cautiously.

verbs.label: Catacombs Altar
verbs.Desc: 'BONE IS THE MEMORY THAT DOES NOT DIE.'

verbs.label: Shrine: the Chancel
verbs.Desc: We do not name these Hours, but we acknowledge that together they are the Chancel, the Cruciate, and the Rode.

verbs.label: Shrine: the Madrugad
verbs.Desc: The Madrugad is the Hour which cannot be unbalanced; which quells and quiets; which comes before the sun.

verbs.label: Altar of the Knot
verbs.Desc: History is woven; a knot is a testament.

verbs.label: Altar: Malachite
verbs.Desc: Honey, the blood; copper, the heart; yew, the root.

verbs.label: Shrine: the Watchman
verbs.Desc: The Watchman is the Hour which navigates; which illuminates; which is not compassionate.

verbs.label: Solar Altar
verbs.Desc: The Sun-in-Splendour is the Hour which was sundered; the Hour which is not conquered; the Hour from which proceed all the other Hours of the day. Or so the Church teaches.

verbs.label: Altar: St Tentreto
verbs.Desc: Saint Tentreto of the Deep Door, who is four times winged: for the Scīmafectra-kind; the Glaeterfleoge-kind; the Thritige-kind; for the kind-within.

verbs.label: My Bed: Adept Cell
verbs.Desc: A bed stamped with sigils to discourage access to the Mansus in dream. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Long Cell
verbs.Desc: A bunk-bed constructed for two immortals who could neither be together, nor apart. [But you sleep here alone. Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Hermit
verbs.Desc: A snug nook where absolutely nobody will bother you. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Infirmary
verbs.Desc: Clean white sheets and the unmistakable military ping of a steel bed-frame. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Librarian's Quarters
verbs.Desc: Librarians are prone to back-ache, and the mattress here has always been a hard one, even in Westcott's time. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Lodge
verbs.Desc: Stout, rustic, snug. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Motley
verbs.Desc: An exile slept here, long ago. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Pale
verbs.Desc: Seven generations of Dewulfs slept here… as did Kitty Mazarine, who never cared much for tradition. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Servant's Quarters
verbs.Desc: Narrow, but comfortable. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Servant's Quarters
verbs.Desc: Narrow, but comfortable. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Servant's Quarters
verbs.Desc: Narrow, but comfortable. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Servant's Quarters
verbs.Desc: Narrow, but comfortable. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Severn Chamber
verbs.Desc: For those who prefer their mattresses soft. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Solomon
verbs.Desc: Julian Coseley and Solomon Husher - both great sages of Winter - slept in this bed. Although not simultaneously. No-one, the story runs, has ever managed a serene night's sleep in it since. [Except you, apparently. Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: My Bed: Violet Chamber
verbs.Desc: Six generations of Dewulf heirs were born in this room. It would have been seven, but Hafren Waters had the ill grace to give birth to Baron Walter in (family legend has it) a cow-byre outside Kerisham. [Add a Fatigued Soul card to nap, a Maladied soul card to cure it, or (once night has fallen) a Memory to dream on it.]

verbs.label: Cage
verbs.Desc: Valentine Dewulf put his only friends in cages. Did he close the cage doors?

verbs.label: Barber's Chair
verbs.Desc: No-one emerges unchanged from a barber's chair. Perhaps they'll just be a little bit more beautiful.

verbs.label: Chrysalis
verbs.Desc: Something might emerge, if it could only be assured of a hospitable History. Until that time, its dreams might be audible to one who presses an ear against its trembling, sky-scented warmth.

verbs.label: Great Clock
verbs.Desc: Every flame has its fuel, and every tick has its tock.

verbs.label: Condignator
verbs.Desc: The terrible heart of the Governor's terrible project.

verbs.label: Desk: Ambrose
verbs.Desc: Ambrose did most of his work downstairs in the foundry and kitchen, or upstairs in the laboratory that later became the Fludd Gallery, but it was at this desk that he composed 'The Temptations of Architecture' and wrote long cross letters to the Times about the flaws of the British constitution.

verbs.label: Desk: Eva
verbs.Desc: A magnificent eighteenth-century secretary desk commissioned for Lady Eva Dewulf, last of the Brancrug Dewulfs.

verbs.label: Desk: Governor
verbs.Desc: A desk as severe and as practical as Collers himself.

verbs.label: Desk: Natan
verbs.Desc: It's an apothecary's desk, all right, but it dates from at least a hundred years after Natan of Regensburg came here. Of course his son, his grandson, and his great-grand-son were all Natans too…

verbs.label: Desk: Nonna
verbs.Desc: Abbess Nonna, apothecary, scholar, dancer.

verbs.label: Desk: Pale
verbs.Desc: Solomon Husher himself commissioned this from Lockwood Fen bog-yew, blackened and half-fossilised by centuries underwater. Here at this desk he wrote his doomy allegory of Winter and its romance with the sun. When he blotted the last word on his manuscript and rose from his work, the timber had turned pale as fresh-cut maple. Or so the story goes.

verbs.label: Desk: Reading Room
verbs.Desc: The bookwheel is a Dewulf heirloom - a gift to Eva Dewulf from her admirer, the adept Franklin Bancroft. The desk and lectern are much more recent. Steel plaques on both read 'TO GERVINUS VAN LAUREN - IN GRATITUDE FOR HIS ASSISTANCE IN THE CLOSING OF THE WINDING STAIR - E. ABNEY-HASTINGS, NOCTURNAL SECRETARY, 1928'

verbs.label: Desk: Vagabond
verbs.Desc: An elegant relic, repurposed by Greene for his small and secret war.

verbs.label: Dispensary
verbs.Desc: A well-appointed laboratory for a scholar of unconventional therapies.

verbs.label: Practice Equipment
verbs.Desc: Still the best place in the House to get hurt.

verbs.label: Foundry
verbs.Desc: Even metal cannot resist these suasions.

verbs.label: Alchemist's Glassware
verbs.Desc: Fragile vessels in which new substances are quickened.

verbs.label: Instrument: Bells
verbs.Desc: 'These are the sounds which may answer thunder.'

verbs.label: Instrument: Quivering Double Bass
verbs.Desc:
'The better it gets, the fewer of us know it.' - Ray Brown 

 [This instrument is possessed of a restless energy.]

verbs.label: Instrument: Hallowed Drum
verbs.Desc:
Celebrate the god of joy - with your own joy!' - The Bacchae 

 [The skin of these drums was the skin of something rare.]

verbs.label: Instrument: Sunset Harp
verbs.Desc:
'I have been a string in a harp; disguised for nine years in water, in the foam of the sea.' - The Battle of the Trees

 [This harp is strung with something that glimmers redly as waves at sunset.]

verbs.label: Instrument: Hunter's Harp
verbs.Desc: This was once strung with yeth-hound gut. Those strings must be long gone, but there's still an unusual savagery to the harp's notes.

verbs.label: Instrument: Organ
verbs.Desc: 'One must practice slowly, then more slowly, and finally slowly.'' - Camille Saint-Saens

verbs.label: Instrument: Grand Piano
verbs.Desc: 'Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.' - Fryderyk Chopin

verbs.label: Instrument: Piano
verbs.Desc: A gift from Kitty Mazarine, who would sometimes pop by of an evening to sing. But her successor Solomon, never one for music, disliked the way its notes would drift up the stairs to the Reading Room, and forbade the staff to play their piano before sunset.

verbs.label: Loom
verbs.Desc: 'And there the golden threads they wove - and in the Moon's House, fast they tied them' - from the Lay of Helgi Hundingsbane

verbs.label: Mirrors
verbs.Desc: It was often said of Lady Eva, later, that she was always good with mirrors.

verbs.label: Nocturnary
verbs.Desc: Constructed by Thirza for her own murky purposes; maintained by the Suppression Bureau for its murkier ones; and available, now, for mine.

verbs.label: Oubliette Containment
verbs.Desc: Fire, iron, dusk, air, all wrenched into a configuration designed to confine something very dangerous. That something is long-gone, but the configuration still has its uses.

verbs.label: Practic Garden Dummy
verbs.Desc: Since the Napoleonic War, he has been punched, thumped, stabbed and shot by amateurs, by professionals, and by tipsy guests after dinner. No wonder he looks so cross.

verbs.label: Governor's Phonograph
verbs.Desc: Collers generally preferred his devices to be as gleamingly modern as possible, but he preferred phonograph cylinders over the newer gramophone records. The cylinder, like the records, exemplified ingenuity and reliably repeated the desired sounds, but they also could be consigned neatly to a cubbyhole without causing any sort of fuss.

verbs.label: Thirza's Phonograph
verbs.Desc: Thirza Blake invited a nameless friend (or according to Brancrug tradition, her sister) to Hush House to recover from an illness. Thirza was uncharacteristically secretive about the whole business, perhaps because her own solicitude embarrassed her. She cooked her guest's meals herself; read to her in the afternoons; and purchased this phonograph so her guest could listen to Viennese opera.

verbs.label: Projector
verbs.Desc: Governor Collers had this installed in the 20s, as a treat for prisoners allowed to recover in the infirmary. Or so he said. Rumour had it he was a secret Keaton fan, and didn't want to motor all the way up to Exeter to see the latest feature.

verbs.label: Loggia Prospect
verbs.Desc: Take counsel with the seas.

verbs.label: Spire Prospect
verbs.Desc: Take counsel with the skies.

verbs.label: Tower-Top Prospect
verbs.Desc: Remember what has passed.

verbs.label: Rowenarium
verbs.Desc: Rowena the Ligeian, protectress of the House, holds the Mare's Key of worm-stone, which opens the door to Nowhere. Now and then, she has lent it unwisely. But only once has she lent it to Ys.

verbs.label: Columbic Sarcophagus
verbs.Desc: 'Sarcophagus': the eater of flesh. No bones remain, but the marble is chilly with power.

verbs.label: Sacred Spring
verbs.Desc: Here a pilgrim would bathe, make offerings, or drown, as they might prefer.

verbs.label: Necropsy Table
verbs.Desc: A hygienic place for scrupulous examination of whatever might remain.

verbs.label: Telescope
verbs.Desc: The scholars of the House watched the courses of the stars to determine their pasts and understand their future.

verbs.label: Windlit Workbench
verbs.Desc: Labour quietly.

verbs.label: Sculptor's Bench
verbs.Desc: Labour seriously.

verbs.label: Gullscry Workbench
verbs.Desc: Labour solemnly.

verbs.label: Hermit's Workbench
verbs.Desc: Labour in solitude.

verbs.label: Exercise Yard
verbs.Desc: The prisoners in the Cucurbit were permitted to grow neither too strong, nor too weak. Here they were subjected to an exacting regime which developed both their bodies and their souls, in accordance with the Governor's designs.

verbs.label: Deeplight Corals
verbs.Desc: Where the wild few traffic with the tides.
